thread.title: State pol’s niece busted for swiping $25G from Brooklyn pharmacy
thread.title_full: State pol’s niece busted for swiping $25G from Brooklyn pharmacy

author: Thomas Tracy
title: State pol’s niece busted for swiping $25G from Brooklyn pharmacy
text:
State lawmaker’s niece busted for pocketing $25G from Brooklyn pharmacy State pol’s niece busted for swiping $25G from Brooklyn pharmacy Police arrested the niece of Assemblywoman Maritza Davila's (pictured), Jesenia Peralta, 27, after she stole $25,000 from the Kraupner Pharmacy in Brooklyn. (Gabel, Pearl/Gabel, Pearl) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Saturday,  32 PM 
Cops have arrested a Brooklyn state legislator’s relative for stealing $25,000 from a business in the pol’s district, officials said Saturday. 
Cops arrested Jesenia Peralta, 27, the niece of Assemblywoman Maritza Davila (D-Brooklyn), on Wednesday for grand larceny charges for stealing money from the Kraupner Pharmacy on Knickerbocker Ave. near Bleecker St., officials said. 
Peralta, who worked at the pharmacy, allegedly used a MoneyGram terminal inside the business to wire cash from the store to a private account she had control over. 
She took about $25,000 between March and June 2016, officials said. 
Kraupner Pharmacy is within Davila’s district, which encompasses parts of Bushwick and Greenpoint. 
A phone call and email to Davila for comment were not immediately returned. Join the Conversation:
